intro: Cliffortia monophylla, commonly known as the single-leafed cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, sandy, or gravelly soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, and it is well adapted to arid and coastal environments. Cliffortia monophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging conditions.
